page.title: 06Army.
page.content: The firing range close to Market Lavington ,Easterton and West Lavington is called Lavington Hill and is part of{Salisbury {Plain.}When the red flag is flying you are not allowed up there,but when it is down you can go up there for walks as long as you walk only on the tracks.As it is a firing range you can often hear them,the noise is mostly made by the Artillery firing their guns.It is most noisy when they are on exercise.You can often see bright lights going up in the air with smoke trailing,these are called flares,but they do not make any noise.Often there are lots of helicopters flying around,but you get used to them after a while.We quite like it in Market Lavington with the Army.
